intro: Valeriana bornmuelleri, commonly known as the mountain valerian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant, flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. Valeriana bornmuelleri is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
